title: Rif Berakhot
text: From when may we recite Shema in the evening? From the time when the Kohanim go in to eat their Terumah until the end of the first watch - these are the words of Rabbi Eliezar. And the sages say: until midnight. Rabban Gamliel says: until the break of dawn.

The rabbis learned: from when may one begin to recite Shemah in the evenings? From the time that people enter [their homes] to eat their bread on Erev Shabbat - these are the words of Rabbi Meir. But the sages say: from the time the Kohanim are clear to eat their Terumah.

A sign for this matter is Tzet Hakokhavim (the emergence of the stars). And even though there is no proof there is a hint to this matter, as it is written in Nehemia 4: "And so we worked on, while half were holding lances, from the break of daw until the stars appeared." And it [also] says there: "that we may use the night to stand guard and the day to do work." [...]
Until the end of the first watch.
